#Text=Mediterranean climates

#Text=Mediterranean climates can be found in several locations around the world outside of the Mediterranean ; they usually have hot , dry summers and mild winters , providing tourist destinations for those who live in colder climates .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Mediterranean climates are a mixture of desert and temperate climates .

#Text=They 're often found 30 to 40 degrees away from the equator , with the Mediterranean climates closest to the equator being more desertlike and Mediterranean climates farther away from the equator being more temperate .

#Text=In some ways , the Mediterranean climate is the optimal climate ; it 's not as hot as the desert in summer but not as cold as the temperate regions in winter , and it 's not as dry as a desert but also not as wet as a temperate climate .
#Text=This provides a lot of good opportunities for outdoor life and , therefore , hiking .

#Text=Most of the rain in Mediterranean climates comes during the winter , with the first rainy days around October ( Northern Hemisphere ; April would be the Southern Hemisphere equivalent ) and the final rainy days in the spring ( often early spring ) .
#Text=There are n't many days of complete cloud cover during summer in Mediterranean climates , and even in winter the sun gets quite high and the days are fairly long ( due to latitude ) .
#Text=There are mostly quite large gaps in temperature between day and night .
#Text=Mediterranean climates can be found around the Mediterranean Sea , particularly to the north of it in Southern Europe .
#Text=However , there are other places with Mediterranean climates ; for example , parts of California and South Africa have Mediterranean climates .
#Text=Typical weather conditions
#Text=Weather to expect in regions with Mediterranean climates varies significantly depending on the time of year .
#Text=Generally , though , Mediterranean climates do not have such distinct seasons as most temperate regions have , and therefore there are only a few possibilities that can be expected :
#Text=Summer : daily temperatures typically reach highs around ; however , cool ocean breezes may lower temperatures significantly during the night .
#Text=When heat waves strike , temperatures may be elevated by as much as 20 degrees Fahrenheit .
#Text=Rain is greatly unlikely , and completely blue skies like in the pictures displayed are common .
#Text=Spring/Fall ( Autumn ) : temperatures are milder than during the summer , but generally the weather is sunny .

#Text=Most travelers will like this time of year the most for going outdoors and hiking or cycling ; however , some years there is not a gradual transition from summer to winter ; instead , temperatures go from being hot to cold within a day or so .
#Text=Winter : winter weather can be a little unpleasant some years , due to cold breezes ; in particular , in Northern California .
#Text=Heavy rainstorms may come during this period , but when they come , they come over a few days and only strike a few days a year .
#Text=In mountainous regions , there may be snow .
#Text=Around the Mediterranean Sea
#Text=If there 's anywhere to first visit for a Mediterranean climate , it 's the region around the Mediterranean Sea .
#Text=It stretches along the northern and eastern sides of the Mediterranean Sea , across to Italy and Greece , and then to Turkey and Israel .
#Text=On the southern , African side of the Mediterranean , the land is drier and mostly is desert .
#Text=The climate of the Mediterranean is largely what makes it such a popular tourist destination .
#Text=California

#Text=This state is known for the warm , dry palm trees in the Los Angeles area , but California 's second-largest urban area ( the Bay Area ) and the countryside surrounding it , and stretching south between the coastline and the Central Valley to Santa Barbara has a Mediterranean climate .
#Text=There are plenty of grass-covered hills and valleys , along with higher peaks scattered here and there , especially in the Diablo Range — peaks include Mount Diablo and Mount Hamilton .

#Text=California 's Mediterranean climate is often found just an hour 's drive inland , where heavy ( in comparative terms ) rains come in the winter , especially during El Niño years , but extremely dry summers follow .

#Text=In spring , the hills and mountains throughout this region are green and covered in wetter places and some sides of hills with oaks and pines ; in summer , the hills turn gold because the grass turns yellow .
#Text=However , in some places like the Altamont Hills , the hills have no trees , and often the grass burns in fires , especially along the sides of major roads .
#Text=See

#Text=The plentiful sunny days provide good opportunities for sightseeing , and while Mediterranean climate regions do n't hold the most dramatic scenery on Earth , they have attractive mixtures of vegetation and terrain that are in contrast to thick forests and deserts found throughout much of the world .
#Text=While the Mediterranean has taken advantage of its Mediterranean climate for tourism , California has n't intentionally promoted its climate and vegetation so much for tourists .
#Text=An exception is Napa Valley 's wine country , where there are miles of vineyards that can survive due to the Mediterranean climate .
#Text=Flora
#Text=Many Mediterranean climate regions are grasslands with woodlands in wetter locations , like on some mountains and alongside creeks .
#Text=( Since Mediterranean climates get almost all of their rain in winter , streams are rarely year-round ) .
#Text=Trees that grow in Mediterranean climates include eucalyptus trees and oaks ; however , the oak trees are small .
#Text=You can also find shrubs in Mediterranean climates , called chaparral , especially on the sides of large ridges and mountains .
#Text=Do
#Text=The good climate of the region makes it good for hiking and recreational cycling in rural areas and , in coastal areas , good for spending time on the beach .
#Text=Mostly , you do n't have to worry about rain spoiling your day , but if rain does come , get prepared for a lot of it .
#Text=Regions with Mediterranean climates are also good for taking photographs because it 's sunny most of the time .
#Text=See also
#Text=Deserts
